      The SCardConnect function establishes a connection (using a specific resource manager context) between the calling application and a smart card contained by a specific reader.
      int _PCSCThreadedExecutor.SCardGetStatusChange(SCARDCONTEXT context, long dwTimeout, de.intarsys.nativec.type.INativeObject rgReaderStates, long readers)

      The SCardGetStatusChange function blocks execution until the current availability of the cards in a specific set of readers changes.
      int _PCSCThreadedExecutor.SCardListReaders(SCARDCONTEXT context, de.intarsys.nativec.type.NativeString mszGroups, de.intarsys.nativec.type.INativeObject mszReaders, NativePcscDword pcchReaders)

      The SCardListReaders function provides the list of readers within a set of named reader groups, eliminating duplicates.
      int _PCSCThreadedExecutor.SCardReleaseContext(SCARDCONTEXT context) 
      int _PCSC.SCardReleaseContext(SCARDCONTEXT hContext)
      PCSC_API LONG SCardReleaseContext(SCARDCONTEXT hContext);
      int _IPCSC.SCardReleaseContext(SCARDCONTEXT hContext)
      The SCardReleaseContext function closes an established resource manager context, freeing any resources allocated under that context, including SCARDHANDLE objects and memory allocated using the SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE length designator.
